data.title: Democratic Republic of Congo – Page 3 – POLITICO
data.meta_description: Latest politics, government and election news for Democratic Republic of Congo
data.text:
Ashton names heads of five EU delegations

Posts filled in Africa and central Asia.

French nationals dominate senior EEAS appointments

Appointments include a new EU special representative (EUSR) for the south Caucasus and Georgia and three directors in the EEAS’s Brussels headquarters.

An African adventure

A footprint tainted by a lack of accountability

The EU should apply tight standards in the mining sector.

The EU needs new laws for trade in minerals

The illegal trade in minerals has fuelled the conflict in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

Navel-gazing won’t help at the UN

The EU’s place as an international power depends more on its actions than on its status at the UN.

Quiet shepherd

He may be polite, but Steven Vanackere, Belgium’s foreign minister, has many supporters.

Europe must do more to help Africa shed its resource curse

Helping Africa does not just involve donating money; it also involves stopping the flight of African states’ money into private accounts.

De Gucht ‘regrets’ remarks about Jews

European commissioner accused of ‘outrageous anti-Semitism’ by Jewish group.

Star-spangled Belgians

Happy birthday, Congo!

Fifty years after gaining independence, the Democratic Republic of Congo remains deeply unstable. To limit the dangers, the help of China and the EU is needed.

Africa’s broken heart

The many ties that bind the Democratic Republic of Congo to Belgium – and Europe – remain tragically entangled.

A very sticky situation

Europe uses very little oil from Canada’s tar sands, but these deposits are provoking sharp debate in the EU.

Europe’s leadership gain was Belgium’s loss

Van Rompuy’s move causes problems in his home country.

Travelling in style?

Different political aims and personal tastes have helped determine how often — and where — the EU’s leaders and commissioners have travelled.

Rendezvous with Africa on climate

It may be a marginal contributor to climate change, but Africa could be a major contributor to efforts to curb climate change.

Comoros crash carrier escapes EU blacklist

EU says Yemenia Airways has responded adequately to safety recommendations since fatal crash.
